snippet: A federal appeals judge allowed Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women late Monday night, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so.
abstract: Federal appeals judge allows Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so; at issue is state rule requiring providers in the program to certify that they do not affiliate with entities that perform or promote abortions.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals judge allowed Texas to ban Planned Parenthood clinics from participating in a health care program for low-income women late Monday night, hours after a lower court prohibited the state from doing so.

headline.main: Texas: Judge Stays Order on Health Care Program
headline.print_headline: Texas: Judge Stays Order On Health Care Program
